creator: ronnie.brunner@netcetera.ch
text:
In both Makefiles (Makefile.am respectively), there is something like:

install-data-hook:
        echo 'removing unwanted libtool .la files'
        rm -fv $(DESTDIR)/$(lib_libexecdir)/*.la

Solaris rm does not support the -v option and therefore fails to install Rivet.

(Applies to all current versions of Rivet, I think.)

creator: mxmanghi@apache.org
text: I tried to figure out if autoconf could be helpfule and maybe provide some macro testing which switches are supported by the 'rm' command, but I couldn't find a way. If you don't have a suggestion I will remove the -v option in order to have a wider compatibility among various Unix species.
Sure: throwing it out would solve the problem. I don't think the reduced verbosity is an issue on any other platform, so I'd definitely vote +1 for just dropping the flag...
